content.description:
The crux of the route is right at the start the very first 8ft. kinda weird climbing after that it's pretty straight forward gain some good ledges and good holds put some pieces in and you are at the top  

  The last like 20 ft. or so are nice easy Trad climbing mostly good gear too 

  Rap down off of the two live pine trees to the left of the climb when you get up top
content.protection: Cams mostly bigger from .75 to 3 or 4
content.location: When you find the cliff face walk up the little hill and look for a wide crack about 8 ft. tall then a nice crack up above it

content.description:
The crux is the run out at the top which tops out in moss about 20 feet above your protection. Walk way up on the right of the cliff this is a broken line of ledges split by a weird crack.  

  The route may look dry from the bottom by can be wet at the top. 

  The gear can be tricky due to the waves in the crack that for weird openings in the crack. 

  Work up and top out and anchor on a tree. Rappel from the same tree.
content.protection: I used a #3, .75, #2 but there is other option.
content.location: On the Horizon Wall this is left of the vertical wall starts on a ledgy crack past Nifkin.

content.description:
This is the wall with a giant horizontal crack that meets up with a vertical crack those are the two climbs that I know of  

  There are only 2 climbs on this wall that I know of and so much potential for more
